com.conceptwave.scripting
Class Controller

com.conceptwave.scripting.Object
  com.conceptwave.scripting.CWScriptable
      com.conceptwave.scripting.CwObject
          com.conceptwave.scripting.Controller
Direct Known Subclasses:
NavTree, RootController
public class Controller
extends CwObject

Controller is an object that represents a User Interface instance at runtime (an instance of com.conceptwave.system.UserInterface metadata type).
The methods listed in the Script Documentation are native java methods available for scripting.
In addition to java native methods, Controller object has script methods defined at the metadata level in the System template.

For method descriptions please refer to Help documentation, section "ConceptWave Documentation > Velocity Studio User Guide > User Interface Modelling > User Interface > User Interface Methods".

To instantiate a User Interface with its model counterpart created as well, you may write the following script:

 //create a document instance
 var doc = new ns.doc1();
 //set some values on the doc here...
 ...
 
 //create the user interface
 var docUI = new ns.doc1.UserInterface(doc);
 
 // Or alternatively, simply:
 var docUI = new ns.doc1.UserInterface();
 
 // OR specify a parent as well as model
 var docUI = new ns.doc1.UserInterface(doc, parent);

You are not necessarily required to set the parental relationship. That is, you may instantiate a User Interface with no parent, even in the scenario of cascading User Interfaces.
However, pop-ups will not work, because the dialog variable, which is set when an object is displayed in a pop-up, is found by going up the parenting chain.

More importantly, setting parental relationship enables sibling User Interface objects to share the parent's Variables, if there are multiple User Interfaces belong under the same parent.

The parameters of User Interface constructor are as follows:
Parameter 1 is the model (e.g. Document, Finder, Order, etc). If it is a top-level User Interface, set to null.
Parameter 2 is the parent User Interface. Set to null if there is no User Interface to parent relationship.

Another way to create a user interface is to use the following generic constructor: 

 var ui = new com.conceptwave.system.UserInterface(fullName,model,parent)
where fullName is the dot-notation string representation of the object, including the namespace name (eg. "ns.doc1ui").

Method Detail

NavigationItems

public List NavigationItems()

cwCanValidate

public com.conceptwave.scripting.Boolean cwCanValidate()
Used for controllers displayed using a navigation bar. Default behaviour is the current object displayed must be validated before the user can go to the next navigation object unless the navigation bar's cwDoValidate is set to false, OR the next object the user wants to view is actually a previous object. See Navigation bar documentation for more info.

Returns:
true if the current navigation object should be validated.

getCurrentApplication

public Scriptable getCurrentApplication()
Returns the current application controller in which this controller is being displayed in.

Returns:
Returns the current application controller in which this controller is being displayed in.

getParentWindow

public Controller getParentWindow()
Gets parent window controller for the current UI.

Returns:
the controller calculated to be the current parent window (either current application, or current dialog)

setContentVariable

public void setContentVariable(com.conceptwave.scripting.Object c)

setModelErrors

public void setModelErrors(ValidationErrorList list)
Sets validation error list for the controller's model object. The old model errors will be replaced with the errors from the new list. NOTE: The setting will be ignored if the method is called in the process of the controller validation.

Parameters:
list - the validation error list to set this model's errors to.

validate

public ValidationErrorList validate(com.conceptwave.scripting.Integer maxNumber)
Validates the controller: the model object and all variables marked with "Validate" flag

Parameters:
maxNumber - A maximum number of validation messages
Returns:
ValidationErrorList list of errors found during validation, if any
